notes: An ANC councillor of the Govan Mbeki Municipality is in a critical condition after being shot during a council meeting.
A large number of power consumers took to the streets of Dadu on Saturday against alleged callousness of local power utility officials and corruption among their employees.
Activists protest against genetically modified crops and pesticides.
An Awami League leader was killed in a stabbing incident by an unidentified group in Savar on 23 May 2015.

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.
The Alliance of Hope for Burundians held a protest march against the 3rd term of Pres Nkurunziza to the Mutaho market in Gitega.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Mubaarak village (30 KM NE) of Qoryooley District in the morning of 23/05/2015 after armed with SNG forces in the village, al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village later and casualties from both sides could not be established.

Members of Gadbursi and Issa clans clashed using sticks and daggers in Xariirad Village (58km SE of Borama) following a dispute over ownership of borehole. The incident happened after the Gudabirsi tried to fence around the well which was immediately opposed by the Issa clan. Two Gudabirsi and one Issa were injured in the clash. Police intervened and dispersed the rival groups.

Habar Gidir militia launched an attack against Biimaal militia basis inside Marka in retaliation of two men killed in the outskirt of Marka on 23/05. The Biimaal militia retreated from their positions after the attack. Two Biimaal militia men were killed in the fighting while unconfirmed number of injuries was confirmed from both sides.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a civilian traditional clan elder in Bukriyay neighbourhood of Baidoa in the morning of 23/05. The reason for the killing is unknown and the killers escaped. The victim was in the past arrested by SNG government for having suspected links with al Shabaab fighters but he was later released.

A man from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan was shot dead by Dhulbahante/Hassan Ugaas sub-clan in the vicinity of (Faleeryaale 32 Km N of Garowe) in the morning of 23/05 following a personal dispute. No arrests were made.
Bus drivers enforced an indefinite strike in Khulna division from 20 - 24 May, in protest against the arrest of a driver and his assistant last Wednesday in a case over robbery in a night coach.

actor1: MNTJP/MNDAA: Myanmar National Truth and Justice Party/Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army
source: Burma News International; Myanmar Peace Monitor
notes: MNDAA and Myanmar army troops clashed in the Shue Pa Hsan area in Laukkai. No casualties were reported.

source: Yemen News Agency SABA; Yemen Data Project
notes: Coalition airstrikes hit a fuel station and a mosque in Ghawlat Dhaydan, Raydah, Amran, injuring several people.

Unidentified militants detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) in al Qatan, Hadramawt, on May 23. The IED, which was likely intended to target a military patrol, killed two civilians and wounded three others when it was detonated. No group has yet claimed credit for the attack.
Unidentified assailants shoot and kill a soldier in El Fasher.
An Awami League leader and a journalist were injured on 23 May 2015 in Dinajpur during an attack on a protest against demanding the arrest of murderers.
A bomb went off near Al-Dilingat Court in the Delta province of Al-Buhayrah [north of Cairo] early Saturday [23 May]. Another explosive charge was also detonated near the cities post office.

location: Al Hudaydah - Al Hudaydah International Airport
source: AP; Yemen Data Project; Khabar News Agency (Yemen)
notes: Coalition airstrikes reportedly targeted the airport, the republican guards and the coastal air defence in Al-Hudaydah city.

Unidentified armed men driving a luxury car shot and killed two civilian men and injured a third one in Korontada junction in Wadajir District in the morning of 23/05/2015. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the attackers fled in their vehicle. One of the victims was working for Ministry of Transportation/licensing Department and others were personal friends to him.

The MQM organised a protest demonstration against what it called the artificial water crisis in the city created by the Pakistan Peoples Party-led provincial government. The protest was held in North Karachi on May 22.
Police attacked on May 23 media personnel stationed outside the Sindh High Court as former provincial home minister appeared at the registrar's office.

actor1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
notes: At least four militants hailing from Umar Khorasani group of outlawed Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) were killed during an overnight (reported May 23) police encounter in Karachi area of Baldia Town.
3 members of the ASWJ were killed by suspected militants in the Malir area of Karachi.
Over 200 people in Port Elizabeth take part in a global march against international biotechnology company Monsanto

Workers and supporters of the MQM protested for the second consecutive day against a water shortage in Orangi town, Karachi. Protesters claim that the water shortage is artificially created by the government to punish MQM supporters

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Movement of forces: 300 FARDC special forces have been deployed to stabilize the Nyunzu area due to intercommunal violence which has taken place recently.

A search took place in Kero, Raman, Yala. The incident is thought to be related to counter-insurgency activities. No weapons were used. There were 0 injuries and 0 fatalities. State forces assumed to be military. State forces assumed to be military.

A high-voltage electricity tower in East-Saqr Quraysh line [southern Cairo] came under an act of sabotage on Saturday [23 May]. Four bombs were found around the electricity tower and three of the bombs went off.
Over 100 activists protest against the use of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) by multinational agrochemical group Monsanto.
Hundreds of protesters marched in Ouagadougou against genetically modified agriculture, especially cotton produced by the Monsanto company.

actor2: SPLM-In Opposition-Welebe: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition (Wesley Welebe Faction)
notes: Military reclaim Mundri from SPLA Weluba faction.
Thousands marched through Bujumbura to attend the funeral of opposition leader Zedi Feruzi who was killed the previous day in a potential assassination.
On 23 May 2015, two persons were killed and three others injured in a clash over land dispute at Sheuly village under Pagla Police Station (Gaffargaon upazila, Mymensingh).

assoc_actor_2: Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Ruop-Agar Sub-Clan Group (South Sudan); Students (South Sudan)
notes: On 23 May 2015, a secondary school student from the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka was killed by 'Ajang' militia (presumed to be Agar Dinka) at an unspecified location in Rumbek Centre county (Lakes state), in what is described as a revenge killing.

assoc_actor_2: Agar Clan Group (South Sudan); Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
notes: On 23 May 2015, a member of the 'Ajang' community (presumed to be Agar Dinka) was killed by militia from the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka at an unspecified location in Rumbek Centre county (Lakes state), for unclear reasons.

source: Yemen News Agency SABA; Yemen Data Project
notes: On 23 May 2015, coalition airstrikes reportedly targeted a House belonging to former president Ali Saleh in Al-Ahmar village, as well as Al-Sawad, Raymah Humaid and Dhabwah military camps in Sanhan district.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
assoc_actor_2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: An Egyptian worker was killed during shelling Saturday in the Libyan city of Benghazi, which witnessed fighting between Islamist militias and forces of the internationally-recognised government.
After the arrest of UNATUs Chairperson, hundreds of teachers stormed the police station.
A policeman sustained injuries after being shot as he drove past an unofficial checkpoint set up by an armed group near the entrance to Sebha Airport.
Gunman shot and killed a man and wounded another in a drive-by shooting in the south of Sebha.

source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: Coalition airstrikes hit a Houthi convoy in al Jabanah, Bajil district.

source: Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: Saudi war jets targeted the historic castle of Bajil in Hodeida governorate with series of air strikes, and attacked again Dhain Mount in Amran governorate, and Mirzaq area in Hajjah governorate.

source: AFP; Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 23 May 2015, coalition airstrikes reportedly targeted the police training centre in Dhamar city.

assoc_actor_1: Al Islah Party; Unidentified Tribal Militia (Yemen)
notes: Clashes reportedly erupted between Houthi-Saleh forces and tribesmen affiliated with the Islah party in the outskirts of Marib city, including in the areas of Al-Jada'an and Al-Salabah areas. The clashes resulted in killing and injuring several people from both sides; unknown fatalities coded as 10 and split across two events.

source: AFP; Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA
notes: On May 22 and 23, Awlaki armed tribesmen and Houthi-Saleh forces clashed in As Said and in the outskirts of Ataq city, Shabwah. According to some estimates, the fighting killed at least 28 people, including 17 Huthis and 11 tribesmen. Houthi forces reportedly took control of a military site in Al Said on the second day. Fatalities split across four events.

source: AFP; Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency SABA

notes: The governor of Shabwah Ahmed Bahaj, affiliated with the Islah party, and two of his escorts were reportedly killed in a car accident in Ataq city, after being ambushed by suspected Houthis.

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.
Employees of an electric provider protest non-payment of salaries 'at the weekend.'

actor2: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army
notes: On 23 May 2015, a battle took place between KIAs 12th Battalion troops and a combined force of Myanmar armies 56th and 86th Light Infantry Battalion (LIB) troops at Nam Lim Pa, La Ait Bum and Nam Hpalang Bum in Mansi Township, Kachin state. One KIA officer and 3 soldiers were killed.
On 23 May 2015, Yemen anti-aircraft reportedly shot down a Saudi fighter jet in Bani Al-Harith district.
On 23 May 2015, Operation Libya Dawn conducted an airstrike on Al-Zaafaran (Sirte, West). Between two to three civilians were killed.
Activists protest against genetically modified crops and pesticides.
3 Security personnel were killed as their vehicle on regular patrol drove over an IED planted by the TTP in Dattakhel Waziristan
A clash broke out between two groups in Dur Mohammad Pato village in the Khairpur area over a land dispute. Police dispersed the clashing parties, injuring several people on May 23.
Residents of Khairpur protested against Sindh police's harsh treatment of Dr Zulfikar Mirza and rallied in support of him

After police dispersed a clash at Dur Mohammad Pato village in the Khairpur area, villagers protested against police officials for their actions and demanded the release of a man they arrested on May 23.

During the election of the Federation of Bangladesh Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FBCCI) on Saturday, clashes between supporters of differnet candidates and between supporters and the police erupted in Dhaka.
Boko Haram attacks Kamburo Karaga, killing 10 residents. Date vague - the attack took place 'at the weekend.'

Houthi forces reportedly took control of several Saudi military sites after shelling them in Al-Dod, Al-Jabry and Al-Dukhan mountains of Jazan governorate; the shelling resulted in killing and injuring several soldiers of the Saudi army. Unknown fatalities coded as 10 and spread over three events.
On 23 May 2015, Saudi artillery reportedly targeted several areas of Harad district.

Houthi forces reportedly took control of several Saudi military sites after shelling them in Al-Dod, Al-Jabry and Al-Dukhan mountains of Jazan governorate; the shelling resulted in killing and injuring several soldiers of the Saudi army. Unknown fatalities coded as 10 and spread over three events. *ACLED defaults to coding the event on the Yemeni side when the source describes a large area along the Saudi-Yemeni border.

Houthi forces reportedly took control of several Saudi military sites after shelling them in Al-Dod, Al-Jabry and Al-Dukhan mountains of Jazan governorate; the shelling resulted in killing and injuring several soldiers of the Saudi army. Unknown fatalities coded as 10 and spread over three events. *ACLED defaults to coding the event on the Yemeni side when the source describes a large area along the Saudi-Yemeni border.

On 23 May 2015, five men who were detained were released to their home villages in Wamena town (Jayawijaya regency, Papua province), and experienced torture and ill-treatment while in detention, including being shot with firearms, shot with teargas bullets, having nails hammered into forearms, sexual assault and beating with a variety of tools including rattan canes, batons, knuckleduster gloves, rifle butts and wooden beams.

Unidentified armed men driving an ambulance opened gunfire at a car transporting three SNG MPs in Shaqaalaha junction area of Hodan District in the afternoon of 23/05. One MP and two bodyguards were killed while another MP was wounded in the attack. The attackers managed to escape from the scene, and the reason for the attack remains unclear yet though al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack. However, the spokesman for the Internal Security Ministry in a press conference in Mogadishu on 24/05 stated that SNG forces driving an armed military vehicle was behind the assassination of the MP in Shaqaalaha area on the 23/05. The spokesman stated that the attack took place irresponsibly as the vehicle transporting the MPs refused to let the armed vehicle to overtake it, which led the military forces vehicle to block the car of the MPs and soldiers on board opened gunfire at the car.
